column4: why cant i make my ubuntu start at IP 192.168.1.3 it always starts at 192.168.1.4?
if it's DHCP then your DHCP server determines your IP
if you want a static IP, configure it manually.
ohhhh you probably had your MAC address change
why not just make a static IP on the client instead of worrying about the router?
doesent that mean I edit the interfaces file telling it to use .3 instead of .4?
i would move it .100+ for DHCP.
do you have the exact router make & model?  i might be able to find a walkthru
THOMSON ST585v6
got it.  give me a minute.
ok thanks man
yeahh tell me about it, it's just some stupid default router I get from the ISP
you might have to burn that thing and buy your own.
can i PM you
http://www.dd-wrt.com/site/support/router-database/
you still there?
yea what's up?  did i break everything?  :)
man you screwed that router man
nah just joking
lol don't mess with me like that!  :P
but that freaking router wont accept my new DHCP pool -.-
lol sorry I wont :D
back to pm?
yeah sure
